segment: Live Nation Entertainment Privacy Policy - Your Privacy Rights   Effective July 20, 2012 (last updated October 08, 2013)

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides the effective date and last update of the privacy policy, which is a generic introductory element commonly found at the beginning of privacy policies.

segment: This Privacy Policy applies to the sites and apps where it appears.   This Policy describes how we treat personal information we collect both online and offline. This includes on our websites or in our apps. It also includes at our box offices or in phone or email interactions you have with us. If you live in Canada, please read our Canadian Privacy Policy.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment provides a general introduction to the scope and applicability of the privacy policy, mentioning where and how it applies without specific details on data practices.

segment: We collect information from and about you.   Contact information. For example, we might collect your name and street address. We might also collect your phone number or email.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of contact information such as name, address, phone number, and email by the first party, likely on their website.

segment: Payment and billing information. For example, we collect your credit card number and zip code when you buy a ticket.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of financial information, specifically credit card numbers and zip codes, when a user purchases a ticket on the website, indicating identifiable data collection for a basic service feature.

segment: Information you post. For example, we collect information you post in a public space on our website or on a third-party social media site.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of information that users post publicly on the company's website or on third-party social media sites, indicating first-party collection on the website.

segment: Demographic information. We may collect information about events you like or products you buy. We might collect this as part of a survey, for example.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of demographic information related to user preferences and purchases, possibly as part of a survey, indicating implicit collection for research purposes.

segment: Other information. If you use our website, we may collect information about the browser you're using. We might look at what site you came from, or what site you visit when you leave us. If you use our mobile app, we may collect your GPS location or your device's unique identifier. We might also collect the type of mobile device you are using, or the version of the operating system your computer or device is running. We might look at how often you use the app and where you downloaded it.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of information about the user's browser, referring and exiting sites, and device-specific data when using the website or mobile app, indicating first-party data collection.

segment: We collect information in different ways.   We collect information directly from you. For example, if you register for a promotion or buy tickets. We also collect information if you post a comment on our websites or ask us a question.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of information directly from users when they register for promotions, buy tickets, post comments, or ask questions on the website, indicating collection on the website.

segment: We collect information from you passively. We use tracking tools like browser cookies and web beacons. To learn more about these tools and to control them, please click here.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates passive collection of information using tracking tools like cookies and web beacons on the website, with an option for users to control these tools via browser/device privacy controls.

segment: We get information about you from third parties. For example, if you use an integrated social media feature on our websites or mobile applications. The third-party social media site will give us certain information about you. This could include your name and email address. Your activities on our sites and apps may be posted to the social media platforms.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes receiving information such as name and email address from third-party social media sites when users use integrated features, indicating third-party sharing/collection.

segment: We use information as disclosed and described here.   We use information to respond to your requests or questions. For example, we might use your information to confirm your registration for an event or contest. If you give us your friend's information, we will only use it to provide services you requested.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of information to respond to user requests or questions, which is categorized under basic service or feature purposes.

segment: We use information to improve our products and services. We might use your information to customize your experience with us. This could include displaying content based upon your preferences.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes using information to improve products and services and to customize user experiences, which falls under the purpose of Personalization/Customization.

segment: We use information to look at site trends and customer interests. We may use your information to make our website and products better. We may combine information we get from you with information about you we get from third parties.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes using information to analyze site trends and customer interests, which aligns with analytics and research purposes.

segment: We use information for security purposes. We may use information to protect our company, our customers, or our websites.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of information for security purposes to protect the company, customers, or websites, categorizing it under 'Service Operation and Security'.

segment: We use information for marketing purposes. For example, we might send you information about special promotions or offers. We might also tell you about new features or products. These might be our own offers or products, or third-party offers or products we think you might find interesting. Or, for example, if you buy tickets from us we'll enroll you in our newsletter. We may use push notifications and your location information on our mobile apps to send you alerts regarding local events. To learn about your choices for these communications, read the choices section below.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of information for marketing purposes, including sending promotions and offers, which is a clear indication of marketing activities.

segment: We use information to send you transactional communications. For example, we might send you emails about your account or a ticket purchase. We might also contact you about this policy or our website terms.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of user information to send transactional communications like emails about accounts or purchases, indicating collection on the website and identifiable contact information for basic service purposes.

segment: We use information as otherwise permitted by law.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the use of information is in accordance with legal permissions, suggesting the purpose is to fulfill legal requirements.

segment: We may share information with third parties.   We will share information within the Live Nation family of companies. This may include Ticketmaster and Live Nation-owned or operated venues, for example.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that information may be shared within the Live Nation family of companies, which includes Ticketmaster and Live Nation-owned or operated venues. This categorizes the sharing as being with other parts of the company or affiliates.

segment: We will share information with third parties who perform services on our behalf. For example, we share information with vendors who help us manage our online registration process or who fulfill your purchases. Some vendors may be located outside of the United States.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with third parties for service operation purposes, such as managing online registration or fulfilling purchases. The third parties are unspecified vendors, some of which may be international.

segment: We will share information with our business partners. This includes a third party who provides or sponsors an event, or who operates a venue where we hold events. Our partners use the information we give them as described in their privacy policies. You should read those polices to learn how they treat your information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with business partners, which includes third parties that provide or sponsor events, indicating a 'Receive/Shared with' action.

segment: We may share information if we think we have to in order to comply with the law or to protect ourselves. For example, we will share information to respond to a court order or subpoena. We may also share it if a government agency or investigatory body requests. Or, we might also share information when we are investigating potential fraud. This might include fraud we think has happened during a sweepstakes or promotion.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with third parties to comply with legal requirements or protect the company, such as responding to court orders or government requests, which falls under 'Receive/Shared with' in Third Party Sharing/Collection.

segment: We may share information with any successor to all or part of our business. For example, if part of our business is sold we may give our customer list as part of that transaction.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with a successor in the event of a business sale, which aligns with the purpose of merger/acquisition.

segment: We may share your information for reasons not described in this policy. We will tell you before we do this.

model_analysis.explanation: The statement indicates that user information may be shared with third parties for unspecified reasons, which implies sharing or receiving information with third parties.

segment: You have certain choices about how we use your information.   You can opt out of receiving our marketing emails. To stop receiving our promotional emails, click here or follow the instructions in any promotional message you get from us. Your device settings should provide you with instructions on how to turn off push notifications. It may take about ten days to process your request. Don't worry! Even if you opt out of getting marketing messages, we will still be sure to send you transactional messages. For example, we may still contact you about your orders.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the user's ability to opt out of receiving marketing emails, which falls under first party use. The opt-out mechanism is provided via a link in the promotional emails.

segment: You can modify information you have given us. To correct or delete information or update account settings, log into your account and follow the instructions. We make changes as soon as we can. This information may stay in our backup files. If we cannot make the changes you want, we will let you know and explain why. If you contact us requesting access to your information, we will respond within 30 days.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how users can modify their account information, indicating access to user account data with the ability to edit it.

segment: You can control cookies and tracking tools. To learn how to manage how we - and our vendors - use cookies and other tracking tools, please click here.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment informs users about the ability to manage cookies and tracking tools, indicating a choice regarding the use of first-party cookies, and suggests the use of browser/device privacy controls.

segment: You can control tools on your mobile devices. For example, you can turn off the GPS locator or push notifications on your phone. Each push notification has an "unsubscribe" link.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes user control over mobile device features like GPS and push notifications, indicating first-party privacy controls.

segment: Your California Privacy Rights.   If you live in California and have an established business relationship with us, you can request a list of the personal information we have shared with third parties for their marketing purposes. We will also give you a list of the third parties that have received your information. You can make a request one time each year.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment addresses the privacy rights specific to California residents, allowing them to request information about data shared with third parties for marketing purposes.

segment: To exercise your rights, you can email us or write to us at the address below. Mention in your letter that you are making a "California Shine the Light" inquiry. We will respond within 30 days.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to the 'California Shine the Light' law, indicating it is addressing the rights of users from California.

segment: These sites and apps are not intended for children.   Our sites and apps are meant for adults. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13. If you are a parent or legal guardian and think your child under 13 has given us information, you can email us here. You can also write to us at the address listed at the end of this policy. Please mark your inquiries "COPPA Information Request."

model_analysis.explanation: The segment specifies that the sites and apps are not intended for children and outlines actions for parents if they believe their child has provided personal information, indicating a focus on children's privacy.

segment: Learn more about COPPA here.

model_analysis.explanation: The mention of COPPA (Children's Online Privacy Protection Act) indicates that the policy is addressing privacy concerns specifically related to children.

segment: We use standard security measures.   We have security measures in place to protect your information. The standard security measures we use will depend on the type of information collected. However, the Internet is not 100% secure. We cannot promise that your use of our sites will be completely safe. We encourage you to use caution when using the Internet. This includes not sharing your passwords. If you think that an unauthorized account has been created using your name, contact us at the address below.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment mentions the use of standard security measures to protect user information but does not specify what those measures are. It also advises users to be cautious, indicating a general approach to data security.

segment: We are TRUSTe certified.

model_analysis.explanation: The mention of TRUSTe certification indicates the existence of a privacy/security program as TRUSTe is known for certifying privacy practices.

segment: TRUSTe has awarded Live Nation the TRUSTe's Privacy Seal. This means TRUSTe independently reviewed this Policy and the practices on Live Nation and Ticketmaster sites and apps to make sure they meet TRUSTE's requirements. The seal applies to our practices for information collected on U.S., UK, Ireland sites and apps.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment describes the TRUSTe Privacy Seal awarded to Live Nation, indicating a review of privacy practices, but does not detail specific practices or user rights.

segment: We keep personal information as long as it is necessary or relevant for our business. We also keep information to resolve disputes, enforce our agreements and as otherwise required by law.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that personal information is retained as long as necessary for business purposes, to resolve disputes, enforce agreements, and comply with legal requirements. This aligns with 'Generic personal information' for type, 'Other' for retention period, and 'Legal requirement' for retention purpose.

segment: We store information both in and outside of the United States.   If you live outside of the United States, you understand and agree that we may transfer your information to the United States. This site is subject to U.S. laws, which may not afford the same level of protection of those in your country.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses the transfer of information to the United States for users living outside the U.S., indicating its relevance to citizens from other countries.

segment: Live Nation complies with the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework as set forth by the U.S. Department of Commerce regarding the collection, use and retention of personal information from European Union member countries. Live Nation has certified that it adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles of notice, choice, onward transfer, security, data integrity, access, and enforcement. To learn more about the Safe Harbor program, and to view Live Nation's certification, please visit http://www.export.gov/safeharbor.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses Live Nation's compliance with the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework, which is specifically related to the handling of personal information from European Union member countries.

segment: We may link to third party sites or services we don't control.   If you click on one of those links, you will be taken to websites we do not control. This policy does not apply to the privacy practices of those websites. Read the privacy policy of other websites carefully. We are not responsible for these third party sites.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses linking to third-party sites, indicating that users may be directed to these sites, which suggests a 'See' action by third parties. It emphasizes that the privacy policy does not cover these sites and advises users to review third-party privacy policies.

segment: Feel free to contact us if you have more questions.   If you have any questions about this Policy or other privacy concerns, you can email us at privacy@livenation.com. Please do not include your credit card number or other sensitive information in your email. You can also write us at:   Live Nation Entertainment, Inc. 9348 Civic Center Drive Beverly Hills, CA 90210 Attention: Privacy Officer, Legal   If you are not satisfied with our response, you can contact TRUSTe here.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides contact information for users to reach out with privacy concerns or questions, which falls under the category of Privacy contact information.

segment: What we will do if there is an update to this policy.   From time to time we may change our privacy practices. We will notify you of any material changes to this policy as required by law. We will also post an updated copy on our website. Please check our site periodically for updates.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses changes to the privacy policy and specifies that users will be notified of material changes by law and an updated copy will be posted on the website. It does not mention any user choice regarding these changes.
